edu.stanford.math.plex4.io

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.io.Table

  • public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds a table of string values. It contains functionality for outputting in comma separated and pretty printed formats.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> row)
        This function adds a data row to the table. It converts each object in the input to a string, by calling the toString function.
        Parameters:
        row - a collection containing the data to add

      • getEntry

        public java.lang.String getEntry(int row,
                        int column)
        This function returns the entry in the table located at (row, column).
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the entry
        column - the column of the entry
        Returns:
        the element at the specified location

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This function returns the string representation of the table. For now it uses the pretty print version.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toCSVString

        public java.lang.String toCSVString(java.lang.String separator,
                           boolean includeTitle,
                           boolean includeHeadings)
        This function creates a string holding the contents of the table in comma separated format.
        Parameters:
        separator - the separator between each column
        includeTitle - if true, then the title is also printed
        includeHeadings - if true, then the headings are printed
        Returns:
        a string containing the contents of the table

      • toPrettyString

        public java.lang.String toPrettyString(java.lang.String separator)
        This function returns a string holding the contents of the table. It pads the columns with spaces so that the columns have uniform width.
        Returns:
        a visually appealing textual representation of the table
